current_contact.agency: San Bernardino County Sheriff Department - Coroner Division

case_circumstances: John Doe #01-64 was found dead in a  "hobo camp" near the Southern Pacific Railroad tracks in Colton, California.  It was estimated that he had died between 10 and 14 days prior to discovery.  He was described a s a White male, appearing approximately 64 years of age, balding, but with gray hair present, with a gray moustache.  He was 5'7" to 5'8" and weighed about 150 lbs.  A leather key case in his possession bore the initials "W.D.P".  He was edentulous, except for  one "lower molar" (unknown right or left).
case_facial_hair: Gray moustache and a few days growth of beard.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_on_body: Gray plaid shirt, gray or green pants (two pair), brown lace boots, gray cap.
case_clothing_with_body: Tan jacket.  Other clothing present at scene was not described.
case_footwear: Brown lace boots with blue socks.
case_other_items_with_body:
A leather key case in his possession bore the initials "W.D.P".  Found at time of exhumation for DNA was an open-face, railroad style pocket watch: Hamilton Watch Company (Lancaster, PA), Model 992, Serial #1233971 “ Manufactured 1915.  The watch case was manufactured by Illinois Watchcase Co. “ Spartan" (serial #958339).  On the inside of the back cover of the cases were two etched number/letter groups, which appear to be as follows:
"M11374H"
"P249" the obscured numbers may be 7 and 2
dental: Dental information / charting is currently not available
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
